title: Load weather data for current GPS location
description: Verify the website automatically detects user's current location via GPS and displays correct real-time weather data including current conditions, hourly forecast, daily forecast, and air quality.

steps.description: Open the website homepage with location services enabled on the browser
Check the app prompts or uses GPS to determine user location
Verify the displayed current weather data matches the data retrieved for the detected coordinates from the backend
Verify hourly forecast for next 8 hours is shown accurately
Verify daily 7-day forecast is displayed correctly
Verify air quality index is shown if available
Confirm dynamic UI theme changes according to current weather conditions
Confirm 'last updated' timestamp appears and is accurate

title: Search weather by valid city name
description: Verify user can search weather data by entering a valid city name, and correct weather information is displayed with full details.

steps.description: Navigate to the website homepage
Enter a valid city name (e.g., 'London') in the search bar
Submit the search
Verify backend API is called with the city query parameter
Check current weather, hourly, daily, and air quality data for the city are displayed correctly
Confirm UI updates with new weather data and background gradients reflecting the city weather
Verify 'last updated' timestamp updates accordingly

title: Search weather by invalid city name and handle error
description: Verify that when the user enters an invalid or non-existent city name, a friendly error message is displayed and the user can retry the search.

steps.description: Navigate to the website homepage
Enter an invalid city name (e.g., 'InvalidCity123') in the search bar
Submit the search
Verify API returns 404 city not found response
Ensure the UI displays a user-friendly error message such as 'City not found' or similar
Confirm search input remains available for retrying
Verify no crash or unresponsive state occurs

title: Handle backend server error gracefully
description: Verify that if the backend returns a server error (500), the UI shows an appropriate error message to the user and allows retrying.

steps.description: Simulate backend server error response (HTTP 500) when requesting weather data
Perform a weather search or load by location to trigger API call
Verify UI displays a clear error message such as 'Failed to fetch weather' or similar
Confirm the user can retry the request without page reload
No app crash or broken UI occurs

title: Verify security of API key
description: Verify that the OpenWeatherMap API key is stored securely on the server side and is not exposed in client-side code, network requests, or frontend source.

steps.description: Inspect network requests during API calls from frontend
Ensure no API key or sensitive secrets appear in request URLs or headers visible to the client
Review frontend source code (browser dev tools) for presence of API key
Verify API key is referenced only in server-side environment variables
Confirm API calls from frontend are routed through backend API proxy endpoints where the key is injected

title: Validate detailed weather metrics accuracy and completeness
description: Verify that all detailed weather metrics (humidity, wind speed, visibility, pressure, air quality, sun cycle information) are displayed and show accurate values consistent with backend data.

steps.description: Load weather data via location or city search
Cross-check each metric visible in UI matches respective value in API JSON response
Verify humidity percentage is displayed and within valid range (0 to 100%)
Verify wind speed units and values are correct and non-negative
Verify visibility metric is shown with correct units and range
Verify atmospheric pressure is displayed in expected units
Confirm air quality index is shown if available, or appropriate message if null
Confirm sunrise and sunset times are displayed and correspond to location/timezone

title: Check UI responsiveness and dynamic theme updates
description: Verify that UI components render properly on different screen sizes and the background gradient changes dynamically to reflect current weather conditions.

steps.description: Open the website on desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes
Verify weather cards, forecast rows, and details grid render consistent and readable layout on each device size
Change the weather location to different weather conditions (e.g., sunny, cloudy, rainy)
Confirm the background gradient and glassmorphic effect update dynamically according to weather condition
Ensure text and UI elements maintain accessibility and contrast across themes

title: Verify performance and quick data loading
description: Verify that the weather data loads promptly after page load or search and UI updates without significant delay or freezing.

steps.description: Load the main page with location detection enabled
Measure time from page load to weather data displayed; it should be within acceptable performance threshold (e.g., under 3 seconds)
Perform a city search and submit
Measure time from search submission to UI update with new weather data; it should be prompt and smooth
Verify that loading skeleton placeholders appear when data is being fetched
Confirm no layout shifts or flashes occur during data updates

title: Verify deployment environment serves the application correctly
description: Ensure that the deployed website runs all features correctly, including API calls, UI rendering, and secure environment variables for API keys.

steps.description: Deploy the application to production environment as per instructions
Open the deployed URL in supported browsers
Verify homepage and search page load without errors
Check weather data loads accurately by location and city search in the deployed app
Verify API key is not exposed in production environment client-side code
Confirm dynamic UI themes function correctly
Verify ability to view detailed weather metrics and forecasts
Check error messages appear appropriately on invalid city or API failures
